project.title: PyOS
project.blurb: A Python-first operating system (32/64-bit) with layered compatibility, sandboxed runtime, and declarative packaging.
project.description: PyOS is an experimental OS concept focused on Python as the primary coordination layer. It explores a microkernel-style core with userland services in Python, secure sandboxes, and compatibility strategies (shims, containers, emulation) to run diverse application families. The long-term research goal is broad, practical portability while maintaining security, reproducibility, and auditability.

versions.notes: Initial public research drop: bootstrap scripts, package manifests, sandbox profiles, compatibility demos.

compatibility.notes: POSIX host integration, OCI containers, Python userland services.
Layered approach; app-by-app manifests choose Wine, WSL, or VM.
Signed bundles TBD; container/VM fallback for non-native targets.
Mobile sandbox; CLI-first with optional web UI.
Heavily constrained; remote execution or VM streaming strategies.
